results.title: Maria going home
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Debby Kingsland and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Maria, originally from Spain, has been in Australia some fifteen years - half her life. In the film she and her family discuss plans to return to Spain. The film is intended to show why a family, materially and professionally successful in Australia and with two Australian born children might choose to uproot themselves a second time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Manefield, Debby Kingsland and Film Australia

results.title: Maria Callas: debut a Paris, 19 decembre, 1958
results.creator_credit: INA France, EMI/Parlophone and Roger Benamon
results.brief_description: In 1958 Maria Callas made her Paris debut in a gala performance in front of the President and the elite of Parisian society. She sings arias and scenes from “La Forza del destino” and “Il Trovatore” by Verdi, “Norma” by Bellini, “Il Barbiere di Siviglia” by Rossini and “Tosca” by Puccini. Tito Gobbi, Albert Lance, Louis Riallan and Jean Paul Hurteau accompany her and the Orchestre et Choeurs du Theatre National de l’Opera de Paris is conducted by Georges Sebastian. The brief commentary is in French and there are no subtitles.

The brief commentary is in French and there are no subtitles.

results.title: Maria Callas in concert: Hamburg, 18 May, 1959 and 16 March, 1962
results.creator_credit: EMI/Parlophone and NDR International TV-Produktions GmbH
results.brief_description: Presenting excerpts from two live stage performances by the famed diva opera singer, Maria Callas, in Hamburg in 1959 and 1962 respectively. This video is an absolute must for lovers of opera combining the musical talents of such composers as Verdi, Bizet, Rossini and Bellini, and all superbly performed by the wonderful Maria Callas, elegant as ever with her distinctive soprano voice and dramatic intensity totally captivating the audience. Her performance is accompanied by the Symphonieorchester des NDR, conducted by Nicola Rescigno (1959) and Georges Pretre (1962). Without commentary or narration.

results.title: Margot Fonteyn
results.creator_credit: Antelope Films, Aurora Productions, Mischa Scorer and Patricia Foy
results.brief_description: Margot Fonteyn is one of the most loved ballerinas of all time. This documentary, made on the eve of her seventieth birthday is an intimate exploration of both her professional and personal life. The four most significant figures in her career, Ninette de Valois, Frederick Ashton, Robert Helpmann and Rudolf Nureyev contribute their memories. Filmed at her home in Panama, the program features excerpts from some of her greatest roles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antelope Films, Aurora Productions, Mischa Scorer and Patricia Foy

results.title: Margin for life: Macquarie Island
results.brief_description: Shows the life of some of the animals on Macquarie Island and some of the activities of the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition, which is based on the island. Indicated that the margin for life is narrow in this environment.

results.title: Margin for error
results.brief_description: Shows the open Canadian and kayak events in a series of white-water touring shots. Points out the factors that are needed for safe canoeing and highlights rescue techniques.

results.title: Margarine from oil
results.brief_description: A general account of the main states in the manufacture of margarine. Photographs of a creamery at work shows the following processes: weighing the correct proportions of oils; mixing the oils with other ingredients; churning, emulsifying, and cooling; kneading and packing the margarine.

results.title: Margaret: Mildly mentally retarded
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Graham Chase and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A retarded child faces many problems, but causes many more. Margaret’s parents are aware of her difficulties, and of the difficulties in the future when Margaret will be old enough to find a job and have boyfriends. One of a series originally created to introduce to the public the range of social services available from government and other agencies.

results.title: Margaret: a pride in identity
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, David Roberts and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Margaret is an urban aboriginal woman who became involved in the pre-school Murawina, first as a mother then later as a trainee pre-school teacher. Margaret is shown at home with her white Australian husband and at work. The film stresses the importance of Aboriginal identity.

results.title: Margaret Thatcher
results.creator_credit: Richard Hughes, Mark Rowland, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
Champion of free minds and markets, Margaret Thatcher helped topple the welfare state and make the world safer for capitalism. In 1975 she challenged Edward Heath for the Tory leadership simply because the candidate of the party’s right wing abandoned the contest at the last minute. Thatcher stepped into the breach and set in motion a series of interconnected events that gave a revolutionary twist to the twentieth century’s last two decades and helped mankind end the millennium on a note of hope and confidence. The triumph of capitalism, the almost universal acceptance of the market as indispensable to prosperity, the collapse of Soviet imperialism, the downsizing of the state on nearly every continent and in almost every country in the world - Margaret Thatcher played a part in each of these transformations. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.
